intro: Fontellaea, commonly known as the "tropical arrowhead," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, as well as parts of the Caribbean. The plants typically have heart-shaped leaves and produce striking, spatulate inflorescences. They are often grown as ornamental plants due to their unique foliage and attractive flowers. Fontellaea species are generally evergreen and thrive in humid, shaded environments.
